001package io.cyborgcode.roa.api.extensions;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.allure.RestClientAllureImpl;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.allure.RestResponseValidatorAllureImpl;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.annotations.ApiHook;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.hooks.ApiHookFlow;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.service.RestService;
008import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.exceptions.HookExecutionException;
009import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.hooks.HookExecution;
010import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.StoreKeys;
011import io.cyborgcode.utilities.reflections.ReflectionUtil;
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.Comparator;
014import java.util.HashMap;
015import java.util.Map;
016import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.AfterAllCallback;
017import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.BeforeAllCallback;
018import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext;
019
020import static io.cyborgcode.roa.api.config.ApiConfigHolder.getApiConfig;
021import static io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.PropertiesUtil.addSystemProperties;
022
023/**
024 * A JUnit 5 extension that processes {@link ApiHook} annotations on a test class
025 *
026 * <p>During {@code beforeAll()} it executes any {@code @ApiHook(..., when=HookExecution.BEFORE, ...)} hooks,
027 * and during {@code afterAll()} it executes any {@code @ApiHook(..., when=HookExecution.AFTER, ...)} hooks.
028 * All hook outputs are collected into a map and stored under the key {@link StoreKeys#HOOKS_PARAMS}
029 * in the JUnit extension context‚Äôs GLOBAL namespace.
030 *
031 *
032 * <p>Hooks are looked up reflectively by type via {@link ReflectionUtil#findEnumImplementationsOfInterface},
033 * then applied via their {@link ApiHookFlow#flow()} consumer.
034 *
035 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
036 */
037public class ApiHookExtension implements BeforeAllCallback, AfterAllCallback {
038
039   static {
040      synchronized (ApiHookExtension.class) {
041         addSystemProperties();
042      }
043   }
044
045   private RestService restService;
046
047   /**
048    * Called once before all tests in the class.
049    *
050    * <p>Gathers all {@link ApiHook} annotations on the test class with
051    * {@link HookExecution#BEFORE}, orders them by {@linkplain ApiHook#order() order},
052    * and invokes {@link #executeHook} on each. Finally, stores the resulting
053    * parameters map under {@link StoreKeys#HOOKS_PARAMS}.
054    *
055    * @param context the current JUnit extension context
056    * @throws Exception if any reflection or hook‚Äêflow error occurs; wrapped in {@link RuntimeException}
057    */
058   @Override
059   public void beforeAll(final ExtensionContext context) throws Exception {
060      Map<Object, Object> hooksStorage = new HashMap<>();
061      ApiHook[] apiHooks = context.getRequiredTestClass().getAnnotationsByType(ApiHook.class);
062      Arrays.stream(apiHooks)
063            .filter(apiHook -> apiHook.when() == HookExecution.BEFORE)
064            .sorted(Comparator.comparingInt(ApiHook::order))
065            .forEach(apiHook -> executeHook(apiHook, hooksStorage));
066      context.getStore(ExtensionContext.Namespace.GLOBAL).put(StoreKeys.HOOKS_PARAMS, hooksStorage);
067   }
068
069   /**
070    * Called once after all tests in the class.
071    *
072    * <p>Gathers all {@link ApiHook} annotations on the test class with
073    * {@link HookExecution#AFTER}, orders them by {@linkplain ApiHook#order() order},
074    * and invokes {@link #executeHook} on each. Finally, stores the resulting
075    * parameters map under {@link StoreKeys#HOOKS_PARAMS}.
076    *
077    * @param context the current JUnit extension context
078    * @throws Exception if any reflection or hook‚Äêflow error occurs; wrapped in {@link RuntimeException}
079    */
080   @Override
081   public void afterAll(final ExtensionContext context) throws Exception {
082      Map<Object, Object> hooksStorage = new HashMap<>();
083      ApiHook[] apiHooks = context.getRequiredTestClass().getAnnotationsByType(ApiHook.class);
084      Arrays.stream(apiHooks)
085            .filter(apiHook -> apiHook.when() == HookExecution.AFTER)
086            .sorted(Comparator.comparingInt(ApiHook::order))
087            .forEach(apiHook -> executeHook(apiHook, hooksStorage));
088      context.getStore(ExtensionContext.Namespace.GLOBAL).put(StoreKeys.HOOKS_PARAMS, hooksStorage);
089   }
090
091   /**
092    * Executes a single {@link ApiHook} by looking up its {@link ApiHookFlow},
093    * then invoking its {@code flow()} consumer with the shared storage map.
094    *
095    * <p>Any exceptions during lookup or execution are caught and rethrown as
096    * {@link RuntimeException} with a standardized message.
097    *
098    * @param apiHook      the hook annotation instance
099    * @param storageHooks the map into which the hook may write parameters
100    */
101   private void executeHook(ApiHook apiHook, Map<Object, Object> storageHooks) {
102      try {
103         ApiHookFlow<?> hookFlow = ReflectionUtil.findEnumImplementationsOfInterface(
104               ApiHookFlow.class, apiHook.type(), getApiConfig().projectPackages());
105         hookFlow.flow().accept(restService(), storageHooks, apiHook.arguments());
106      } catch (Exception e) {
107         throw new HookExecutionException("Error executing ApiHook: " + apiHook.type(), e);
108      }
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Lazily instantiates (and then caches) the {@link RestService} used by hooks.
113    * On first call, creates a new {@link RestService} with Allure‚Äêenabled
114    * implementations; on subsequent calls, returns the same instance.
115    *
116    * @return the singleton RestService for this extension
117    */
118   @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:JavadocParagraph")
119   private RestService restService() {
120      if (restService == null) {
121         restService = new RestService(new RestClientAllureImpl(), new RestResponseValidatorAllureImpl());
122      }
123      return restService;
124   }
125
126}
